alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 7:55PM EDT until April 01 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL ATLANTIC...CENTRAL OCEAN...SOUTHEASTERN BURLINGTON AND EASTERN MONMOUTH COUNTIES... At 754 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Long Branch to 6 miles east of Barnegat to near Egg Harbor City, moving east at 60 mph. This storm recently produced a 58 mph wind gust at Millville. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Lakewood, Middletown, Barnegat, Tinton Falls, Hammonton, Red Bank, Beachwood, Manasquan, Highlands, Point Pleasant Beach, Buena, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Seaside Heights, Weymouth and Estell Manor. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 30 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 42 and 112. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 10 and 26. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern and central New Jersey. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
